subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tesing-testing
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
----------MB_8CCCCC776D7D215_175C_14DCA_webmail-d037.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"

 My guide, David told me that when we become fully conscious over there we =
are dead here, like when we dream if we were to become fully conscious and =
wake up over in the spirit world, we are dead here, and cannot come back to=
 the physical world, that's why when we do obe's they are made up of both t=
he real thing (spirit traveling) and a dream state to keep us from dying in=
 the physical. sf

 



-----Original Message-----
From: Fiona Broome <e=
mail@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri, May 28, 201=
0 4:23 pm
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tesing-testing

          =C2=A0          =
                        Hi,
 
 Frank, I love that you posted this.  That's =
the kind of logic that keeps me in this field.  These aren't simple dilemma=
s or logic problems... they're huge, possibly crossing dimensions.
 
 Thoug=
h grasping the full implications can be a continual challenge, I'm reminded=
 of the sparkle in Sherlock Holmes' eye when he said, "The game is afoot!" =

 
 (I'm even more amused by the more complete quotation from Shakespeare's=
 play, Henry V: "The game's afoot!
 Follow your spirit!")
 
 I think we nee=
d to test every theory -- pushing each of them beyond "sensible" limits, in=
 some cases -- to find new answers.
 
 For me, this is tremendously excitin=
g, and the "what if...?" questions get better & better.  Sure, maybe some (=
or many) of them lead nowhere, but they're such fun to explore!  
 
 (And, =
if they shed even a tiny light on the real answers, that might be all we ne=
ed to take the next step forward in the research.)
 
 Like you, I think qua=
ntum studies are a major part of what we're trying to figure out.  This is =
such an exciting time!  I feel like I'm standing in front of a huge buffet =
of clues, and I'm considering how they might all fit together... or at leas=
t how to fit more of them on my plate to study them! *grin*
 
 A month ago,=
 I would have said that EVP was interesting, but nothing I'd pursue.  Havin=
g heard crystal clear voices, day after day, when I was in Canada... I'm ho=
oked.  
 
 The idea that you can take the English language radio stations o=
ut of the equation and still hear unmistakably clear phrases... wow!
 
 Any=
way, your post made me smile.  This is exactly what intrigues me about para=
normal studies.
 
 Thanks!
 
 Cheerfully,
 Fiona
 
 --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
 >
 >  Wow=
, sounds just like EVP, sometimes "they" talk about earthquakes, and
 > =
bombing, but major events are often not mentioned as well. I think all this=

 > stuff is connected.
 > 
 >  It's gets weirder, if you get thes=
e specific warnings, you can put the
 > though "out there", not allowing=
 it to happen, and it seems to affect the
 > predicted event. So who is =
to say if a prediction was false, or it was not
 > allowed?
 > 
 >=
  Skeptics need not chime in! I mean, I think everything functions on the
 =
> quantum level and we effect it, or even recreate it.
 > 
 >  F-S=

 > 
 
 
      
                 
   
       
  

=3D

e, David told me that when we become fully conscious over there we are dead=
 here, like when we dream if we were to become fully conscious and wake up =
over in the spirit world, we are dead here, and cannot come back to the phy=
sical world, that's why when we do obe's they are made up of both the real =
thing (spirit traveling) and a dream state to keep us from dying in the phy=
sical. sf<br>
</div>

</div>

<div>Hi,<br>
 <br>
 Frank, I love that you posted this.  That's t=
he kind of logic that keeps me in this field.  These aren't simple dilemmas=
 or logic problems... they're huge, possibly crossing dimensions.<br>
 <br>=

 Though grasping the full implications can be a continual challenge, I'm r=
eminded of the sparkle in Sherlock Holmes' eye when he said, "The game is a=
foot!" <br>
 <br>
 (I'm even more amused by the more complete quotation fro=
m Shakespeare's play, Henry V: "The game's afoot!<br>
 Follow your spirit!"=
)<br>
 <br>
 I think we need to test every theory -- pushing each of them b=
eyond "sensible" limits, in some cases -- to find new answers.<br>
 <br>
 F=
or me, this is tremendously exciting, and the "what if...?" questions get b=
etter & better.  Sure, maybe some (or many) of them lead nowhere, but t=
hey're such fun to explore!  <br>
 <br>
 (And, if they shed even a tiny lig=
ht on the real answers, that might be all we need to take the next step for=
ward in the research.)<br>
 <br>
 Like you, I think quantum studies are a m=
ajor part of what we're trying to figure out.  This is such an exciting tim=
e!  I feel like I'm standing in front of a huge buffet of clues, and I'm co=
nsidering how they might all fit together... or at least how to fit more of=
 them on my plate to study them! *grin*<br>
 <br>
 A month ago, I would hav=
e said that EVP was interesting, but nothing I'd pursue.  Having heard crys=
tal clear voices, day after day, when I was in Canada... I'm hooked.  <br>
=
 <br>
 The idea that you can take the English language radio stations out o=
f the equation and still hear unmistakably clear phrases... wow!<br>
 <br>
=
 Anyway, your post made me smile.  This is exactly what intrigues me about =
paranormal studies.<br>
 <br>
 Thanks!<br>
 <br>
 Cheerfully,<br>
 Fiona<br=
>
 <br>
